title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1244.20 - Wharf demurrage, removal of cargo
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1244.20 - Wharf demurrage, removal of cargo

State Regulations

Cargo remaining on terminal premises after the expiration
of the free time period provided in the schedule of charges and cargo intended
for loading on a watercraft but not loaded thereon prior to clearance of such
watercraft, may, unless arrangements have been made for the payment of wharf
demurrage thereon, be piled or repiled by the Port Authority to make space, or
transferred to other locations at the terminal or removed from the terminal to
public or private warehouses; such piling, repiling, or removal will be at the
risk of loss and expense of the holder of the permit for the berth at which the
watercraft was moored. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1244.20

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
